slides.title: What is Pollution?
slides.content:
# Contamination üå´Ô∏è

Introduction of harmful materials into the environment.
- **Point Source**: From a specific pipe (Factory).
- **Non-Point Source**: Scattered (Runoff from city streets).

slides.title: Air Pollution
slides.content:
# Bad Air üò∑

- **Particulates (PM2.5)**: Tiny dust entering lungs.
- **NOx / SOx**: Acid rain precursors.
- **Smog**: Sunlight + Pollutants = Ozone at ground level.
- Causes asthma and heart disease.

slides.title: Water Pollution
slides.content:
# Dirty Water üö∞

- **Sewage**: Disease (Cholera).
- **Industrial Waste**: Heavy metals (Mercury, Lead).
- **Oil Spills**: Coats birds/fish.
- **Nutrient Runoff**: Fertilizer.

slides.title: Eutrophication
slides.content:
# Dead Zones üíÄ

Too many nutrients (Nitrogen/Phosphorus) in water.
1. Algae Bloom.
2. Algae die and rot.
3. Bacteria eat them and use all Oxygen.
4. Fish suffocate.

slides.title: Soil Pollution
slides.content:
# Toxic Ground ‚ò¢Ô∏è

- Pesticides/Herbicides.
- Landfills leaking (Leachate).
- Industrial dumping.
- Contaminates food we grow.

slides.title: Plastic Pollution
slides.content:
# Forever Trash ü•°

Plastic doesn't degrade, it breaks into **Microplastics**.
- Found in Marianas Trench and human blood.
- Animals eat it mistaking it for food.

slides.title: Waste Management
slides.content:
# Bin It üóëÔ∏è

- **Landfill**: Burying it (Methane risk).
- **Incineration**: Burning it (Energy, but ash/gases).
- **Recycling**: Melt and reuse.
- **Composting**: Rotting organic waste.

slides.title: Bioremediation
slides.content:
# Bug Cleanup ü¶†

Using microbes/plants to clean pollution.
- Bacteria that eat oil spills.
- Sunflowers absorbing radiation (Chernobyl).
- Nature healing nature.

slides.title: Noise Pollution
slides.content:
# Loud üîä

Excessive noise harms health.
- Stress, Sleep loss, Hearing loss.
- Disturbs animals (Whales using sonar).

slides.title: Light Pollution
slides.content:
# Bright Nights üí°

Artificial light at night.
- Disrupts circadian rhythms.
- Confuses baby turtles.
- Can't see stars.

slides.title: Thermal Pollution
slides.content:
# Hot Water üõÅ

Factories dumping hot water into rivers.
- Warmer water holds less Oxygen.
- Kills fish.

slides.title: Tech Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: The use of bacteria to clean up an oil spill is called:

slides.title: Mercury and Bioaccumulation
slides.content:
# Up the Chain üé£

Toxins build up in the food chain.
- Plankton eat mercury.
- Small fish eat plankton.
- Big fish eat small fish (More mercury).
- You eat Tuna (Most mercury).

slides.title: London Smog
slides.content:
# History Lesson üå´Ô∏è

1952 Great Smog.
- Coal smoke trapped by weather.
- Killed 12,000 people.
- Led to Clean Air Acts.

slides.title: Acid Rain
slides.content:
# Burning Rain ‚òî

SOx and NOx mix with clouds $\to$ Sulfuric/Nitric Acid.
- Kills forests and lakes.
- Dissolves statues.
- Solved by scrubbers on smokestacks.

slides.title: Radioactive Waste
slides.content:
# Long Hazard ‚ò¢Ô∏è

Waste from nuclear power/weapons.
- Dangerous for 10,000+ years.
- Storage in deep geological repositories.

slides.title: The Solution: Prevention
slides.content:
# Stop at Source üõë

Cleaning up is hard/expensive.
- Prevent pollution before it happens.
- Green Engineering.
- Ban harmful chemicals (CFCs, DDT).

slides.title: Pollution Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Air, Water, Soil** are all vulnerable.
- **Plastic** doesn't go away.
- Technology and Regulation have cleaned up a lot (Acid Rain, Ozone).
- Still much to do.
